isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9800 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - ELECTRIC WIPER MOTOR

svcsubproc.title: Remove

step1.para: Remove mounting screws and remove center top section of dash panel for access ( Figure 66).
Remove screws securing flex duct hoses. Remove A/C, heater, and defroster flex hoses ( Figure 66 and Figure 67).
Remove mounting screw ( Item 1, Figure 66) retaining dash panel brace rod ( Item 2, Figure 66) at windshield area. Move rod aside ( Figure 67).
Remove left and center defroster duct grille covers.

Remove 2 screws from inside edge of dash panel at windshield area and at left and right side panels where they join at windshield area. This will allow the dash panel to flex when removing defroster duct tube.
Remove screws retaining defroster duct tube to dash panel assembly.
Pull defroster duct tube from dash panel assembly.
Pull electrical wire harness next to wiper motor back about 3 or 4 inches (76 or 102 mm) for access to wiper motor.

note.para: Wire harness is difficult to pull. Be sure that you do not break or pull any other wires from their connections.

caution.para: When working with tools in the open dash area, be careful that you do not touch tools to hot electrical connections.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 68 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Remove 2 Torx head screws (Item 7) securing wiper motor/bracket (Item 1) to cab cowl mounting plate (Item 2).

note.para: The wiper motor/bracket (Item 1) lower section is secured to the cab cowl mounting plate (Item 2) with flat head pins (Item 8) on wiper motor/bracket. These pins fit into a slotted hole (Item 9) and slide to the right side about 3/8 inch (9.5 mm). This secures the wiper motor/bracket lower section to the cab cowl mounting plate.

step1.para: If wiper motor will operate, turn ignition key to ON position. Momentarily operate wiper switch to move wiper motor/bracket (Item 1) to the left (driver's side) about 3/8 inch (9.5 mm). Stop wiper action when this is achieved. Turn ignition key to OFF position. If motor does not operate, it may be necessary to tap the wiper motor/bracket to the left (driver's side) to release it from the slotted holes (Item 9) in the cab cowl mounting plate (Item 2).

Grab wire harness and pull back about 3 or 4 inches (76 or 102 mm). Then pull wiper motor ( Figure 67) from cab cowl mounting plate (Item 2). If wiper motor is not free of cab cowl mounting plate, repeat step 10.

Pull wiper motor/bracket (Item 1) away from cab cowl mounting plate (Item 2) far enough to remove spring clip (Item 5) retaining wiper linkage (Items 3 and 4) to wiper pivot arm (Item 6). Remove driver side linkage, then remove passenger side linkage from wiper pivot arm.
Remove electrical connection from wiper motor/bracket assembly (Item 1). Remove motor assembly.

note.para: The wiper motor, mounting bracket, pivot arm and nut are serviced as one unit.

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 68 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Position wiper motor/bracket (Item 1) in place and connect electrical connector to motor.
Place passenger side wiper linkage (Item 4) onto wiper pivot arm (Item 6), then place driver side wiper linkage (Item 3) onto wiper pivot arm and secure them with spring clip (Item 5).
Place wiper motor/bracket flat head pins (Item 8) into cab cowl mounting plate (Item 2) slotted holes (Item 9).

Hold wiper motor/bracket (Item 1) in against cab cowl mounting plate (Item 2). If wiper motor will operate, turn ignition key to ON position. Using wiper switch, operate motor momentarily. Wiper motor/bracket assembly will slide to the right (passenger side) about 3/8 inch (9.5 mm). Turn off wiper switch and turn ignition key to OFF position. Repeat operation if not achieved the first time. Be sure mounting bracket pins are in place. If motor does not operate, it may be necessary to tap the wiper motor to the right (passenger side) to secure flat head pins (Item 8) in slotted holes (Item 9) in the cab cowl mounting plate (Item 2).
Using a suitable drift punch, align upper right wiper motor/bracket mounting hole with upper hole in cab cowl mounting plate (Item 2). Leave drift in hole.
Install Torx head screw (Item 7) in upper left side mounting hole. Do not tighten at this time.
Remove drift punch and install right side Torx head screw (Item 7). Tighten both screws.
Check wiper motor operation.
Install defroster duct tube into dash panel.
Install screws securing defroster duct tube to dash panel. Then install center and left grill covers.
Install 2 screws on inside edge of dash panel at windshield area and at left and right side panel where they join at windshield area.
Install all A/C, heater, and defroster flex hoses ( Figure 66 and Figure 67).
Position dash panel brace rod ( Item 2, Figure 66) in place at windshield area and install mounting screw ( Item 1, Figure 66).
Install center top section of dash panel and install mounting screws.
